column4: there is a problem with 295.40 imo. The nvidia-current-updates package seems much happier.
i;m not talking about just recent events. i'm talking about what i have seen on this channel in the past 6 years.
you have opinion. i have 6 years of logs. :)

Again... I am sure you have ati problems, and intel problems... we use compositing and accelleration for h264 in our project, and nvidia has always worked just dandy... we auto detect and install... and it all works great, except this latest slew... your "opinion" is noted
like i said, it is opinion based on a very deep experience with Ubuntu users.
and mine is based on making all of these work without any user interaction at all... on any hardware with any display.
go edit that paste for XavierCosta. and don't forget that DNS belongs in that file as of 12.04
then no paste, just a quick typing of 2 lines.
<XavierCosta> L3top I should write cat   /etc/network/interfaces on command line, right? No eth0 stuff comes bye, just auto lo on first line and then on second line iface lo inet loopback
then type a paste for XavierCosta to duplicate. far easier than line-by-line on the channel.
I was unaware 1204 required a DNS
it can still be set via DHCP, but for static setups /etc/resolv.conf is deprectaed.

we have purged/installed/--reinstalled... installed the proprietary nvidia driver (a joy in itself as it is currently broken nvidia-173)... gnash, lightspark... everything is right, everything is pointing right... I am at a loss for our friend AssociateX.
He no longer has a previous kernel... did a fresh install
